stories.title: Dependency free image color extraction library

stories.text:
Comparing my pre-pandemic (in-person) and current remote working situations, I believe that I would be more productive and creative if I meet regularly in person with my coworkers. Doesn't have to be 5 days a week - in fact, a mix of remote and in-person enable important, focused work. Though remote seems to work well for a lot of people, I can't help but miss in-person interactions and the spark that they bring.

I'm looking at positions at startups and wish there was a filter for (current or eventual) in-person collaboration. I suspect that this may be the case for others who are on the hunt, so I hope that this thread can be generally helpful.

Which companies are hiring specifically for in-person roles? How many days a week are in person? (SF Bay Area roles would be particularly appreciated!)
stories.title: Ask HN: Which companies are hiring in-person teams?
React.js GitHub Issues After Declaring Support for Ukraine
SAP is stopping business in Russia
Show HN: Turn your Wordle score into music

stories.text:
My company (based in the UK) has a number of software engineering positions open at the moment. We were considering using one of the many team augmentation providers who source engineers in Eastern Europe as we're finding supply in the UK job market too constricted at the moment.

We're in a position to sponsor work visas, and would happily take on the additional effort required to do the paperwork and help people settle in the UK who have been displaced from the Ukraine.

The problem is that I have no idea how to execute this idea. It's likely this will only be viable for people who have already left the Ukraine for Poland or Hungary, and I don't know how to find them or let them know about this opportunity.

Maybe the HN community has some ideas that would help.
stories.title: Ask HN: How to reach displaced Ukrainian developers
